THE LESSONS OF THE CONTRAST

Evi-:RY rule of true art is deeply divine, and as we find human art must always display light by shadow, so in God’s drama of the Christ the divine virtue shows its unique character in contrast with—what have we found the greatest contrast to the divine—murder ? cruelty? slander? dishonesty? lying? These bear only an incidental part in the Gospel story, except as at the last murder touches Jesus through the hand of the Church. The shadow which lies blackest behind the light is human religion.
